summary: George DeMohrenschildt is an individual of interest to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The Central Cover Staff (CCS) held files pertaining to him. The documents provided are memoranda responding to HSCA requests for information on various individuals and entities, including DeMohrenschildt. The memoranda detail the types and quantity of documents held by the CCS on DeMohrenschildt, as well as the contents and dates of relevant files. The documents suggest that DeMohrenschildt was considered relevant to the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: George DeMohrenschildt's significance in the JFK context stems from the HSCA's interest in him and the existence of files on him held by the Central Cover Staff (CCS). The documents suggest he was considered a person of interest in relation to the assassination, warranting investigation by the HSCA.
